intro: Elatostema lushuiheense, commonly known as the Lushuihe Elatostema, is a rare species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
